title: [Interruption of the aortic arch with no patent ductus arteriosus: is survival possible?].
abstract: Interruption of the aortic arch is a rare congenital disease. It is defined by the complete interruption between the ascending and descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus is necessary to maintain flow from the pulmonary to the descending aorta. Its closure leads to a cardiovascular collapse and this malformation is therefore duct-dependent. However, in rare cases, survival remains possible even after ductus arteriosus closure. We report such a case.
categories: Congenital Hereditary and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
